climbs.name: The Way of the Hueco
climbs.fa: Rob Pizem, Lane Mathis, Dakota Walz (Sep 19')

content.description:
This route starts on a leftward trending slab on huecos. Continue to follow huecos and cracks to the summit. The final pitch wanders and follows the path of least resistance. Clip in on the P4 rappel to make it to the next station. Enjoy the huecos and adventure.

P1: 5.9

P2: 5.10

P3: 5.9

P4: 5.10

P5: 5.9
content.location: This is the furthest route to the left on the wall. It is the lowest angle of the three and is quite obvious.

climbs.name: The Water Kelpie
climbs.fa: Rob Pizem, Lane Mathis, Ari Menitove (June 19')

content.description:
Strap in because The Water Kelpie is an amazing rock climb. The first pitch is 5.13 or 5.11 C1 if you pull on the long slings. Other than that nothing is harder than 11+ on the route and pitch 2 is one my personal favorite pitches of 5.10 I have ever climbed.

Full 35m rappels. Bolts can often be found in huecos so slings will prevent drag.

P1: 5.13

P2: 5.10

P3: 5.11+

P4: 5.11+

P5: 5.11+
content.location: Immediately right of the black water streak in the center of the wall.

climbs.name: Over Two Soon
climbs.fa: Rob Pizem, Darren Mabe, Mike Brumbaugh, Brent Barghahn

content.description:
Start on a slab and work your way up the huecos until you summit. The crux is located on P4 and is totally rad. The final pitch (5) is a bit wandering and follows the path of least resistance although the bolts are in line. Bolts are often in the back of huecos (best stone). Rappels are 35m so watch your ends. Clip in on P4 rap in order to make it to the belay.

P1: 5.11-

P2: 5.11-

P3: 5.11-

P4: 5.11

P5: 5.10
content.location: The route is the cone shaped collection of huecos that goes up the right side of the wall. Immediately to the right is a light water streak.
